instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PM_S0_PGOOD: What is PM_S0_PGOOD?  PM_S0_PGOOD is created when CPUVR_PGOOD and ALL_SYS_PWRGD are present and branches off to become PM_PCH_PWROK. PM_S0_PGOOD and SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD are necessary to create SYS_PWROK_R and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK .
definitions.C1950: What is C1950? Capacitor between PP3V42_G3H & ground on pin 8 of U1950 on 2013-2015 Macbook Pros & Airs that often corrodes. When corroded, pin 8 on U1950 will be damaged, which will prevent machine from booting and cause PM_SLP_S4_L to pulse. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  9.3V
threads.message: Macbook Air had liquid damage but didn't find major damage, After ultrasonic macbook turns on with no video, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> have 9.3V and other power rails also shows extra voltage than it should be

[SOLVED]Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  9.3V
threads.message: Where was the liquid damage? Is CPU Vcore present? Change the battery in your meter or get another one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  9.3V
threads.message:
Yes, CPU Vcore is working 1.76volt present. 
Liquid damage was near tiny bit near <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> , nothing major anywhere

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  9.3V
[SOLVED]Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  9.3V
threads.message:
After replacing battery on meter here is the new readings 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.60V
PPBUS S5 HS COMPUTING ISNS 8.60V
PPBUS S5 HS OTHER ISNS 8.60v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.5volt
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.44v 
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.35volt 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5.15volt
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> 5.15v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5.15v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.35v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> 3.35v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.35v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> 3.35v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 3.35v 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL> 3.35v

while testing all power rails, found missing <SIGNAL>PM_S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL>, because no input on pin 8 track was bad beacause of liquid damage, replaced <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR> and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>
macbook is working fine now. 
Thanks to duke for all help. 
Promblem Solved :)
